poem:
Title: "In the Shadow of the Sahara"

Under a Moroccan morning's blush,
From a bivouac emerged a man so old yet bold,
To Sahara's whispering sand, no need to hush,
By others he was greeted, by miles, he was hold.

Their chorus, a singular cheer in vast loneliness,
Absorbed by dunes, like his age, countless.
Oh, Harry Hunter, you embody relentless,
The sunniest ambition in desert's ruthless wilderness.
